body_html:
@drpngx now I understood your proposal :

a_is_bigger = tf.tanh((a-b) / width)
y = a_is_bigger * a + (1 - a_is_bigger) * b

When a is close to b, the growing parameter width will increase the difference between a and b to make a_is_bigger be 1 or 0.

What do you think about
width = 10^(floor(log(abs(a-b))))
?

Even with a-b = 10^-9, a_is_bigger will be about 0.7. I think we can improve this.

I do not know about floor and abs gradient thus.

And finally, it still do not work when a=b. may be we should add an epsilon like a-b+epsilon.

```
a_is_bigger = tf.tanh((a-b) / width)
y = a_is_bigger * a + (1 - a_is_bigger) * b
```
When a is close to b, the growing parameter width will increase the difference between a and b to make a_is_bigger be 1 or 0.

What do you think about
`width = 10^(floor(log(abs(a-b))))`
?

Even with a-b = 10^-9, a_is_bigger will be about 0.7. I think we can improve this. 

I do not know about floor and abs gradient thus.

And finally, it still do not work when a=b. may be we should add an epsilon like a-b+epsilon.
